text: "We are committed to serving the world鈥檚 people, and to accountability for the resources with which we are entrusted"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"#COVID19 does not discriminate between rich nations and poor, large nations and small. It does not discriminate between nationalities, ethnicities or ideologies"-@DrTedros

As part of its response to the #COVID19 outbreak, WHO has activated its R&D Blueprint initiative to accelerate the development of diagnostics, vaccines and therapeutics for the new #coronavirus. https://bit.ly/2xgbwC4

The experts are asking everyone to follow recommendations to prevent the transmission of the #COVID19 and protect the health of all of us. They also thank everyone for trusting the scientific community.

Under WHO鈥檚 coordination, a group of experts from across the world is working towards the development of vaccines against #COVID19. Here is the full list of experts: https://bit.ly/3a7s38C #coronavirus

In the absence of evidence, WHO does not recommend BCG vaccination for the prevention of #COVID19. WHO continues to recommend neonatal BCG vaccination in countries or settings with a high incidence of #tuberculosis. https://bit.ly/3a9Xi2R

There is no evidence that the Bacille Calmette-Gu茅rin vaccine (BCG) protects people against infection with #COVID19. Two clinical trials addressing this question are underway & WHO will evaluate the evidence when it is available. https://bit.ly/3a9Xi2

If #HealthWorkers are at risk of #COVID19, we are all at risk. To stay safe, they need training & personal protective equipment. - We have online courses at http://OpenWHO.org in many languages - We work with private sector, partners to send supplies

"In an editorial last week, development ministers from the , , , , , and calling on all countries to join this common endeavour. They said that tackling this disease together is our only option. I couldn鈥檛 agree more"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus
I would like to thank the for its generous contribution of 拢200M to the global response to #COVID19. We greatly appreciate this demonstration of global solidarity-@DrTedros

"Our global connectedness means the risk of re-introduction and resurgence of #COVID19 will continue. Ultimately, the development and delivery of a safe and effective vaccine will be needed to fully interrupt transmission"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"As the #COVID19 pandemic has spread, its public health and socioeconomic impacts have been profound, and have disproportionately affected the vulnerable. Many populations have already experienced a lack of access to routine, essential health services"-@D

"Countries must balance between measures that address the mortality caused by #COVID19, and from other diseases due to overwhelmed health systems, as well as the social economic impacts"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

" communities are fully educated, engaged & empowered to adjust to the 鈥渘ew norm鈥? Every country should implement a comprehensive set of measures to slow down #COVID19 transmission & save lives, with the aim of reaching a steady state of low-level

"[The new strategy] It includes 6 criteria for countries as they consider lifting restrictions that: transmission is controlled health system capacities are in place to detect, test, isolate & treat every #COVID19 case & trace every contact"-@DrTe

"To support countries in making these decisions, WHO will tomorrow be publishing its updated strategic advice. The new strategy summarizes what we鈥檝e learned and charts the way forward"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"As I've said many times, physical distancing restrictions are only part of the equation & there are many other basic public health measures that need to be put in place"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"Meanwhile, schools have closed for an estimated 1.4 billion children. This has halted their education, opened some to increased risk of abuse, and deprived many of their primary source of food"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

How do you survive a lockdown when you depend on your daily labor to eat? News reports from around the world describe how many people are in danger of being left without access to food-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"But while some countries are considering how to ease restrictions, others are considering whether to introduce them 鈥?especially many low- and middle-income countries in Africa, Asia and Latin America"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"That means control measures must be lifted slowly, and with control. It cannot happen all at once. Control measures can only be lifted if the right public health measures are in place, including significant capacity for contact tracing"-@DrTedros #COVID1

"We know that in some countries, #COVID19 cases are doubling every 3 to 4 days. However, while COVID-19 accelerates very fast, it decelerates much more slowly. In other words, the way down is much slower than the way up"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"We know that the #coronavirus can spread more easily in crowded environments like nursing homes. We know that early case-finding, testing, isolating caring for every case & tracing every contact is essential for stopping #COVID19 transmission"-@DrTed

"Evidence from several countries is giving us a clearer picture about this virus, how it behaves, how to stop it & how to treat it. We know that #COVID19 spreads fast & we know that it is deadly 鈥?10 times deadlier than the virus responsible for the 2

"As we鈥檝e said many times before, this is a new virus & the first pandemic caused by a #coronavirus. We鈥檙e all learning, all the time & adjusting our strategy, based on the latest available evidence. We can only say what we know & we can only act

"In both cases, these decisions must be based first on foremost on protecting human health, and guided by what we know about the #coronavirus and how it behaves. Since the beginning, this has been an area of intense focus for WHO"-@DrTedros #COVID19

Some countries and communities have now endured several weeks of social and economic restrictions. Some countries are considering when they can lift these restrictions; others are considering whether and when to introduce them-@DrTedros #COVID19 #corona

Mums and dads, you deserve praise! You are stars! Looking after kids 24-7 during #COVID19 isn鈥檛 easy. Remind yourself of what you did well today. Think about the good moments. More parenting tips while we #StayAtHome https://bit.ly/ParentingCOVID19 #coron

Read a book with your children. This new book of Sara and Ario's adventure can help under-12s understand and come to terms with #COVID19. More parenting tips while #StayAtHome https://bit.ly/ParentingCOVID19 #coronavirus

Talk to your children about #COVID19. It鈥檚 hard for them not to hear about it. Silence & secrets do not protect our children. Honesty & openness do. Think about how much they will understand. You know them best. More parenting tips while #StayAtHo

Crowded and messy home? Kids crying? Teenagers screaming? Back-to-back online meetings? Take a deep breath. Take a break. Do something for yourself. Take care of yourself so you can take care of your children More parenting tips during #COVID19 https://bi

A structured day helps kids feel secure and makes it easier to manage them. Try making a timetable, with schoolwork, games, free time, exercise and handwashing. Take charge of your days - routine up! More parenting tips during #COVID19 https://bit.ly/Pare

Praise is powerful. Try praising your child or teenager for something they have done well. Do it in a genuine way. They may not show it, but you鈥檒l see them doing that good thing again. More parenting tips during #COVID19 https://bit.ly/ParentingCOVID19 #

Catch bad behaviour early and redirect your kids' attention from a bad to a good behaviour. Clear, positive instructions get us the behaviour that we want. Swap 鈥榙on鈥檛 make a mess鈥?for 鈥榩lease put away your pens鈥?More parenting tips during #COVID19 https:

Exercise helps kids with a lot of energy (and adults) to de-stress when we #StayAtHome. Let your child choose the music and have a 10-minute dance! You might even impress them with your moves! More parenting tips during #COVID19 https://bit.ly/ParentingCO

Try taking 20 minutes doing something the kids choose 鈥?like playing a game or reading - together with them. No phone or TV so you can focus on them. Quality time will make them feel safe and loved. More parenting tips during #COVID19 https://bit.ly/Paren

Working from home with your children around? Your kids are bored and want to play outside but they can't? NOT EASY for any of us! More parenting tips during #COVID19 https://bit.ly/ParentingCOVID19 #coronavirus

"Every month, we will need to ship at least: -100M medical masks & gloves -up to 25M N95 respirators, gowns & face-shields -up to 2.5M diagnostic tests -large quantities of oxygen concentrators & other equipment for clinical care"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coro
"This initiative will be coordinated by WHO and @WFP, building on existing collaboration between multiple partners from within and outside the @UN"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"To support countries, WHO has launched three tools to help managers and planners calculate the #healthworkers, supplies and equipment that will be needed for the increase in #COVID19 patients"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"Within , common problems are the late recognition of #COVID19, or lack of training or inexperience in dealing with respiratory pathogens. Many #healthworkers are also being exposed to large numbers of patients in long shifts with inadequate rest periods"

We are particularly concerned by the large numbers of infections reported among #healthworkers. In some countries there are reports of up to 10% of health workers being infected. This is an alarming trend-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

As we put all our resources and energy behind #COVID19, let us also remind ourselves not to compromise on the routine health services like non-communicable diseases, vaccination services - @PMBhutan Lotay Tshering #WHA73

We have always emphasized the importance of free and quality health care for all and now His Majesty the King is personally spearheading the combat against #COVID19 in #Bhutan. - @PMBhutan Lotay Tshering at #WHA73

In times like this #COVID19 pandemic, we are once again asked to reflect on the efforts and importance we have placed on public healthcare systems, mainly the universal healthcare system for all. - Prime Minister Lotay Tshering at #WHA73

This #COVID19 pandemic has also put us at a crossroads where leaders have to determine which road to take 鈥?the road to promote health, or the road to protect the economy. We have to do both. -#Paraguay President @MaritoAbdo at #WHA73

All of us are equal. The #coronavirus certainly thinks we are all equal. It also taught us that all of us can do something to help others to find a solution to the problems we now face. -#Paraguay President @MaritoAbdo at #WHA73
"For everything #COVID19 has taken from us, it has also given us something: A reminder of what really matters; And the opportunity to forge a common future"-@DrTedros #WHA73
"But #COVID19 has also reminded us that for all our differences, we are one human race, and we are stronger together"-@DrTedros #WHA73

#COVID19 has robbed us of people we love; It鈥檚 robbed us of lives and livelihoods; It鈥檚 shaken the foundations of our world; It threatens to tear at the fabric of international cooperation-@DrTedros #WHA73

"We鈥檒l continue working with countries & partners to ensure equitable access to the tools to prevent, detect & treat #COVID19; We鈥檒l continue supporting countries to prepare & respond; We鈥檒l continue working with countries to sustain essential health

"We鈥檒l continue bringing together leading experts from around the to develop technical advice, based on the best science; We鈥檒l continue driving research and development to develop evidence about vaccines, diagnostics and therapeutics"-@DrTedros #COVID19
We will continue providing strategic leadership to coordinate the global #COVID19 response; We鈥檒l continue providing the with epidemiological information and analysis-@DrTedros #WHA73
WHO鈥檚 focus now is fighting the #COVID19 pandemic with every tool at our disposal. Our focus is on saving lives-@DrTedros #WHA73

"I thank Member States for adopting the #COVID19 resolution, which calls for an independent and comprehensive evaluation of the international response 鈥?including, but not limited to, WHO鈥檚 performance"-@DrTedros #WHA73

Protecting health is a fundamental right for all & working together with all govts will make the difference. I call on WHO & all Member States to face this #COVID19 with a better sense of intl cooperation -#Colombia President @IvanDuque at #WHA73

We must, first of all, combat this #COVID19 pandemic. We need to put in place a solution that everyone can stand behind. I am convinced that we will be able to overcome this pandemic when we work together. -Chancellor of #Germany , Angela Merkel at #WHA63

In the face of crisis human kind must choose solidarity & cooperation over the pursue of individual interest. The world must unite under the banner of mutual trust & inclusiveness in the face of deepening #COVID19 crisis. - @moonriver365 at #WHA73

Only if we join forces will we beat this #COVID19 pandemic. We need WHO for its irreplaceable coordinating role, scientific expertise, knowledge of the situation on the ground. We need a strong WHO & the WHO is us: Member States. - @EmmanuelMacron #WH

The fragility exposed by the #coronavirus is not limited to our health systems. It affects all areas of our world and our institutions - @UN Secretary-General @antonioguterres at #WHA73

The #COVID19 pandemic is asking us two fundamental questions: What sort of world do we want? And what sort of WHO do we want? The answer to the first question will determine the answer to the second-@DrTedros #WHA73
"The #COVID19 pandemic has tested, strengthened and strained the bonds of fellowship between nations. But it has not broken them"-@DrTedros #WHA73
The #COVID19 pandemic is posing a similar threat 鈥?not just to human health, but to the human spirit. We have a long road ahead in our struggle against this virus"-@DrTedros #WHA73

"More than ever, #COVID19 illustrates why investing in health must be at the centre of development. Health is not a reward for development; it鈥檚 a prerequisite. Health is not a cost; it鈥檚 an investment. Health is a pathway to security, prosperity and peac

"#COVID19 is not just a global health emergency, it鈥檚 a vivid demonstration of the fact that there is no health security without resilient health systems, or without addressing the social, economic, commercial and environmental determinants of health"-@Dr

"However, much work remains to be done. Even before #COVID19, the world was off track for the @GlobalGoalsUN. The pandemic threatens to set us back even further. It exploits and exacerbates existing gaps in gender equality, poverty, hunger and more"-@DrTe

I am calling on all nations to invest in strengthening and implementing the many tools at our disposal 鈥?especially the global treaty that underpins global health security: the International Health Regulations-@DrTedros #COVID19 #WHA73
Today I am calling on all nations to resolve that they will do everything it takes to ensure that the 2020 #COVID19 pandemic is never repeated-@DrTedros #WHA73
"If there is anything positive to come from the #COVID19 pandemic, it must be a safer and more resilient world"-@DrTedros #WHA73
"Whatever lessons there are to learn from the #COVID19 pandemic, the greatest failing would be to not learn from them & to leave the in the same vulnerable state it was before"-@DrTedros #WHA73
One thing is abundantly clear. The must never be the same. We do not need a review to tell us that we must all do everything in our power to ensure this never happens again-@DrTedros #COVID19 #WHA73

"In fact, the existing independent accountability mechanisms are already in operation. The Independent Oversight Advisory Committee has today published its 1st report on the #COVID19 pandemic, with several recommendations for both the Secretariat & Me

"We all have lessons to learn from the #COVID19 pandemic. Every country and every organization must examine its response and learn from its experience. WHO is committed to transparency, accountability and continuous improvement"-@DrTedros #WHA73

"We鈥檝e: -informed, engaged & empowered people -fought the infodemic, combating myths with reliable information -called consistently for the two essential ingredients for conquering #COVID19: national unity & global solidarity"-@DrTedros #WHA73

"We notified countries, issued guidance for #healthworkers within 10 days & declared a global health emergency, our highest level of alert, on the 30th of Jan. At the time, there were less than 100 cases & no deaths outside "-@DrTedros #COVID19 #W
"Since day one, WHO has stood shoulder-to-shoulder with countries in these darkest of hours. WHO sounded the alarm early, and we sounded it often"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #WHA73
"It takes hard work, fidelity to science, learning and adapting as you go, and difficult decisions"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #WHA73

Some countries: -are succeeding in preventing widespread community transmission -have issued #StayHome orders & imposed severe social restrictions to suppress community transmission -are still bracing for the worst-@DrTedros #COVID19 #WHA73

"Low-income countries, small island developing states and those suffering from violence and conflict are trying to confront this threat in the most challenging of circumstances"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #WHA73

"For all the economic, military and technological might of nations, we have been humbled by this very small microbe. If #COVID19 is teaching us anything, it鈥檚 humility"-@DrTedros #WHA73

The #COVID19 pandemic is a reminder of the intimate & delicate relationship between people and planet-@DrTedros #WHA73

The health impacts of the #COVID19 pandemic extend far beyond the sickness & death caused by the virus itself. And yet this is so much more than a health crisis-@DrTedros #WHA73

"Strong and resilient health systems are the best defence not only against outbreaks and pandemics, but also against the multiple health threats that people around the world face every day"-@DrTedros #COVID19
The #COVID19 pandemic has highlighted the importance of strong national and sub-national health systems as the foundation of global health security and universal health coverage-@DrTedros
The risk of returning to lockdown remains very real if countries do not manage the transition extremely carefully-@DrTedros #COVID19

" that health system capacities are in place to detect, isolate, test and treat every #COVID19 case and trace every contact that outbreak risks are minimized in special settings like health facilities and nursing homes"-@DrTedros

"As more & more countries consider how to ease so-called lockdown restrictions, I want to reiterate the criteria that WHO recommends countries consider: that surveillance is strong, #COVID19 cases are declining & transmission is controlled"-@DrTedros
"Importantly, the framework takes a 鈥渉ealth first鈥?approach, recognizing that strong and resilient health systems must be the foundation of recovery in all countries"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"Today鈥檚 guidance complements the @UN framework for socio-economic response to #COVID19, published last week. The framework lays out a 鈥渞ecovery roadmap鈥?for countries to: -protect lives & livelihoods -get businesses & economies up & running a

"We must address this now & in the long-term by prioritizing diagnosis & care for those who are most at risk. This is not only the right thing to do, it鈥檚 the smart thing to do. We cannot end the #COVID19 pandemic until we address the inequalities that ar

"For example, it suggests using telemedicine wherever possible, and leaving insecticide-treated nets for #malaria at the door of households, instead of asking people to collect them from a central location"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"It includes practical recommendations for countries on sustaining essential services at the community level, leveraging community #healthworkers for the response to #COVID19 while keeping them safe & advice for how to adapt services for specific dise
"Today, WHO, @UNICEF and the @ifrc have published guidance for countries on how to maintain community-based health care in the context of #COVID19"-@DrTedros
"Around the world, the pandemic has caused severe disruption to essential health services 鈥?including to community-based health care"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"However, even within regions and within countries we see divergent trends. Every country and every region needs a tailored approach. But the impact of the #COVID19 pandemic goes far beyond the numbers of cases and deaths"-@DrTedros

"Although the number of #COVID19 cases reported from Western Europe is declining, more cases are being reported every day from Eastern Europe, Africa, South-East Asia, the Eastern Mediterranean and the Americas"-@DrTedros
"But these are not just numbers 鈥?every single case is a mother, a father, a son, a daughter, a brother, sister or friend"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"More than 3.5 million cases of #COVID19 and almost 250,000 deaths have now been reported to WHO. Since the beginning of April, an average of around 80,000 new cases have been reported to WHO every day"-@DrTedros

"We encourage countries to follow WHO鈥檚 advice, which we are constantly reviewing and updating as we learn more about the virus, and as we learn more from countries about best practices for responding to it"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"As Professor Houssin explained, the committee has also made recommendations for countries, and we encourage countries to pay careful attention to that advice"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"We will continue working with countries and partners to enable essential travel needed for pandemic response, humanitarian relief and cargo operations, and for countries to gradually resume normal passenger travel"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"We will continue supporting countries to sustain essential health services, including vaccination, care for women during pregnancy and childbirth, and care for non-communicable diseases, including mental health conditions"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"But we鈥檙e not only advising countries. We also have advice for individuals around the world, especially those who are now adjusting to a new reality. We know that for many people, life is changing dramatically"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"We know that if this disease takes hold in these countries, there could be significant sickness and loss of life. But that is not inevitable. Unlike any pandemic in history, we have the power to change the way this goes"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"We鈥檝e said from the beginning that our greatest concern is the impact the #coronavirus could have if it gains a foothold in countries with weaker health systems, or with vulnerable populations. That concern has now become very real and urgent"-@DrTedros

"I鈥檓 grateful that so many young people are spreading the word & not the virus. Solidarity is the key to defeating #COVID19 - solidarity between countries, but also between age groups. Thank you for heeding our call for solidarity, solidarity, solidarity"

Perceptions, rumours & feedback on #COVID19 from camp residents & host communities should be monitored & responded to through trusted communication channels, especially to address negative behaviours & social stigma associated with the #corona

Risk communications should work with influencers in the community such as community leaders, religious leaders, women leaders & local health workers to promote #COVID19 safe practices like hand washing, respiratory hygiene & social distancing http://b
When a #COVID19 case is confirmed at a collective site, contacts need to be identified & monitored for 14 days, even when quarantine or isolation is not possible http://bit.ly/2Wv68oY #coronavirus

To allow early detection of #COVID19 cases, epidemiological surveillance, alert notification, case investigation & case reporting need to be implemented in camp settings http://bit.ly/2Wv68oY #coronavirus

People living in collective sites like camps are vulnerable to #COVID19 because of the health risks associated with movement/displacement, overcrowding, increased climatic exposure, poor sanitation & nutrition, & their health condition http://bit.

Displaced persons, asylum seekers, refugees & other people in humanitarian situations, as well as migrants and host communities, must be included in all #COVID19 preparedness and response plans http://bit.ly/2Wv68oY #coronavirus

We鈥檙e all in this together. And we can only succeed together-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"This amazing spirit of human solidarity must become even more infectious than the #coronavirus itself. Although we may have to be physically apart from each other for a while, we can come together in ways we never have before"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"Like me, I鈥檓 sure you have been touched by the videos of people applauding #healthworkers from their balconies, or the stories of people offering to do grocery shopping for older people in their community"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"This is the defining global health crisis of our time. The days, weeks and months ahead will be a test of our resolve, a test of our trust in science, and a test of solidarity. Crises like #COVID19 tend to bring out the best and worst in humanity"-@DrTed

"As the #coronavirus moves to low-income countries, we're deeply concerned about the impact it could have among populations with high HIV prevalence or malnourished children. We鈥檙e calling on every country & individual to do everything they can to sto

"WHO has issued new clinical guidance, with specific details on how to care for children, older people and pregnant women. So far, we have seen epidemics in countries with advanced health systems. But even they have struggled to cope"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #

"Once again, our key message is: test, test, test. This is a serious disease. Although the evidence we have suggests that those over 60 are at highest risk, young people, including children, have died"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"People infected with #COVID19 can still infect others after they stop feeling sick, so these measures should continue for at least 2 weeks after symptoms disappear. Visitors should not be allowed until the end of this period. There are more details in WH

"Assign one person to care for the #COVID19 patient, ideally someone who is in good health and has no underlying conditions. The care-giver should wash their hands after any contact with the patient or their immediate environment"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"For example, both the #COVID19 patient & their care-giver should wear a medical mask when they are together in the same room. The patient should sleep in a separate bedroom to others and use a different bathroom"-@DrTedros

"Another option is for patients with mild #COVID19 to be isolated & cared for at home. Caring for infected people at home may put others in the same household at risk, so it鈥檚 critical that care-givers follow WHO鈥檚 guidance on how to provide care as s

"In that situation, countries should prioritize older patients & those with underlying conditions. Some countries have expanded their capacity by using stadiums & gyms to care for mild #COVID19 cases, with severe & critical cases cared for in hospital

"WHO advises that all confirmed #COVID19 cases, even mild cases, should be isolated in health facilities, to prevent transmission & provide adequate care. But we recognize that many countries have already exceeded their capacity to care for mild cases

"Every day, more tests are being produced to meet the global demand. WHO has shipped almost 1.5 million tests to 120 countries. We鈥檙e working with companies to increase the availability of tests for those most in need"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"We have a simple message for all countries: test test test. Test every suspected #COVID19 case. If they test positive, isolate them & find out who they have been in close contact with up to 2 days before they developed symptoms & test those peopl

"But the most effective way to prevent infections & save lives is breaking the chains of #COVID19 transmission. To do that, you must test & isolate. You cannot fight a fire blindfolded. And we cannot stop this pandemic if we don鈥檛 know who is infected

"But on their own, they aren't enough to extinguish this #COVID19 pandemic. It鈥檚 the combination that makes the difference. As I keep saying, all countries must take a comprehensive approach"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"Even if you cannot stop #COVID19 transmission, you can slow it down and save lives"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"Third, reduce #COVID19 transmission. Do not just let this fire burn. Isolate the sick & quarantine their contacts. Measures that increase social distancing may help reduce transmission. These measures should be based on local context & risk asses

"Second, detect, protect and treat. You can鈥檛 fight a virus if you don鈥檛 know where it is. Find, isolate, test and treat every case, to break the chains of #COVID19 transmission. Every case we find and treat limits the expansion of the disease"-@DrTedros

"The experience of , , and others clearly demonstrates that aggressive testing and contact tracing, combined with social distancing measures and community mobilization, can prevent #COVID19 infections and save lives"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

We have never before seen a pandemic sparked by a #coronavirus. And we have never before seen a pandemic that can be controlled at the same time. WHO has been in full response mode since we were notified of the first cases-@DrTedros #COVID19

"Describing the situation as a pandemic does not change WHO鈥檚 assessment of the threat posed by this #coronavirus. It doesn鈥檛 change what WHO is doing, and it doesn鈥檛 change what countries should do"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"Pandemic is not a word to use lightly or carelessly. It is a word that, if misused, can cause unreasonable fear, or unjustified acceptance that the fight is over, leading to unnecessary suffering and death"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

Let hope be the antidote to fear. Let solidarity be the antidote to blame. Let our shared humanity be the antidote to our shared threat-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus
"We鈥檙e encouraged that #Italy is taking aggressive measures to contain its #COVID19 epidemic, and we hope that those measures prove effective in the coming days"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"The rule of the game is: never give up. But that can only be achieved with aggressive action, as early as possible. Half-hearted measures will leave the door ajar for the #coronavirus"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"Of the 4 countries with the most cases, is bringing its #COVID19 epidemic under control & there is now a decline in new cases being reported from . Both these countries demonstrate that it鈥檚 never too late to turn back the tide on this #coronavirus"-

"For the moment, only a handful of countries have signs of sustained community transmission. Most countries still have sporadic #COVID19 cases or defined clusters. We must all take heart from that"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

The fundamental elements of the #COVID19 response are the same for all countries: Laboratory testing Treating patients & hospital readiness Infection prevention & control All-of-society & all-of-government approach-@DrTedros #coronavirus

The fundamental elements of the #COVID19 response are the same for all countries: Emergency response mechanisms Risk comms & public engagement Case finding & contact tracing Public health measures-@DrTedros #coronavirus
"Depending on their context, countries with #COVID19 community transmission could consider closing schools, cancelling mass gatherings and other measures to reduce exposure"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"In areas with community spread, testing every suspected #COVID19 case and tracing their contacts becomes more challenging. Action must be taken to prevent transmission at the community level to reduce the epidemic to manageable clusters"-@DrTedros #coron
"For the first three categories, countries must focus on finding, testing, treating and isolating individual #COVID19 cases, and following their contacts"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"WHO has consolidated our guidance for countries in 4 categories: -with no #COVID19 cases -with sporadic cases -with clusters -with community transmission. For all countries, the aim is the same: stop transmission & prevent the spread of the #coronavi

"Countries that continue finding and testing #COVID19 cases and tracing their contacts not only protect their own people, they can also affect what happens in other countries and globally"-@DrTedros #coronavirus
All countries must take a comprehensive blended strategy for controlling their #COVID19 epidemics & pushing this #coronavirus back-@DrTedros

"This is an uneven epidemic at the global level. Different countries are in different scenarios, requiring a tailored response. It鈥檚 not about containment or mitigation 鈥?which is a false dichotomy. It鈥檚 about both"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"It鈥檚 also important to remember that looking only at the total number of reported #COVID19 cases & the total number of countries doesn鈥檛 tell the full story. Of all the cases reported globally so far, 93% are from just four countries"-@DrTedros #coro

"We need to remember that with decisive, early action, we can slow down the #coronavirus and prevent infections. Among those who are infected, most will recover. Of the 80,000 reported #COVID19 cases in #China, more than 70% have recovered and been discha

"The great advantage we have is that the decisions we all make 鈥?as governments, businesses, communities, families & individuals 鈥?can influence the trajectory of this #COVID19 epidemic"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"Now that the #coronavirus has a foothold in so many countries, the threat of a pandemic has become very real. But it would be the first pandemic in history that could be controlled. The bottom line is: we are not at the mercy of this virus"-@DrTedros #CO
"Over the weekend we crossed 100,000 reported cases of #COVID19 in 100 countries. It鈥檚 certainly troubling that so many people & countries have been affected, so quickly"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

Key considerations to prevent or reduce #COVID19 risks AFTER a meeting or event: Retain the names & contact details of all participants for at least one month. This will help public health authorities trace people who may have been exposed to COVID-19

Key considerations to prevent or reduce #COVID19 risks DURING a meeting or event: If there is space, arrange seats so that participants are at least one meter apart Open windows and doors whenever possible to make sure the venue is well ventilated #corona

Key considerations to prevent or reduce #COVID19 risks DURING a meeting or event: Encourage participants to cover their face with the bend of their elbow or a tissue if they cough or sneeze Provide contact details or a health hotline number #coronavirus

Key considerations to prevent or reduce #COVID19 risks DURING a meeting or event: Practice ways to say hello without touching Encourage regular hand-washing or use of an alcohol rub by all participants http://bit.ly/3cFoauf #coronavirus

Key considerations to prevent or reduce #COVID19 risks BEFORE a meeting or event: Develop and agree a response plan in case someone at the meeting becomes ill with symptoms of COVID-19 (dry cough, fever, malaise) More http://bit.ly/3cFoauf #coronavirus

Key considerations to prevent or reduce #COVID19 risks BEFORE a meeting or event: Actively monitor where COVID-19 is circulating. Advise participants in advance that if they have any symptoms or feel unwell, they should not attend. More: http://bit.ly/3cF

Key considerations to prevent or reduce #COVID19 risks BEFORE a meeting or event: Pre-order sufficient supplies & materials, incl. tissues & hand sanitizer for all participants. Have surgical masks available to offer anyone who develops respirator

"#COVID19 is a serious disease. It is not deadly to most people, but it can kill. We鈥檙e all responsible for reducing our own risk of infection, and if we鈥檙e infected, for reducing our risk of infecting others."-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"There鈥檚 still a lot we don鈥檛 know, but every day we鈥檙e learning more & we鈥檙e working around the clock to fill in the gaps in our knowledge. Ultimately, how deadly this #coronavirus will be depends not only on the virus itself, but on how we respond to it
"If you feel overwhelmed by fear, reach out to those around you. Find out what your community鈥檚 emergency response plans are, how you fit in and how you can help"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"One thing that we would ask is unity at the national level and solidarity at the global level. More than ever, the human race should stand together to defeat this virus"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"WHO is now working to provide the critical strategies, solutions and supplies that countries will need in the coming weeks and months"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"Our commitment remains to serving all the people of the world with science, solidarity and solutions, but above all with humility and respect to all people and nations"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"We share the grief and pain of so many people around the world, and we share the hope that we will overcome the #COVID19 pandemic together. There鈥檚 one thing we haven鈥檛 done: we haven鈥檛 given up. And we will not give up"-@DrTedros
"We鈥檝e worked with tech companies to fight the infodemic. We鈥檝e kept the world informed in multiple ways, including these regular press conferences, answering your questions"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"We鈥檝e brought together thousands of experts to analyze the evolving evidence & distil it into guidance. We鈥檝e convened researchers to identify priorities, from all over the "-@DrTedros #COVID19

"It鈥檚 almost 3 months since we declared the highest emergency and that鈥檚 what was suggested by the Emergency Committee 鈥?to evaluate the evolution of the pandemic, and to advise on updated recommendations"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"WHO is committed to transparency and accountability. In accordance with the International Health Regulations, I will reconvene the Emergency Committee tomorrow"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"We started our early press conference. People were saying the world will be tired of you if you鈥檙e making a press conference every day, but we didn鈥檛 mind. We wanted to make sure the world understands what WHO is saying"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"On the 30th of Jan, I reconvened the Emergency Committee & after receiving their advice, declared a global public health emergency, WHO鈥檚 highest level of alarm. At the time, there were less than 100 cases & no deaths outside #China"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"We discussed the seriousness of the situation and agreed that an intl. team of scientists should travel to #China to look into the outbreak and the response, incl. experts from , , , , , , and "-@DrTedros #COVID19

"On the 27th of January, I traveled to Beijing with WHO鈥檚 chief of emergencies @DrMikeRyan other senior WHO staff, and met with President Xi Jinping and other leaders to learn more about the response and offer WHO鈥檚 assistance"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"On the 22nd and 23rd of January, I convened the Emergency Committee, consisting of 15 independent experts from around the world. At the time, 581 cases had been reported, and only 10 cases outside #China"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"On the 20th and 21st of January, WHO staff visited Wuhan, , and on the 22nd, reported that the evidence suggested human-to-human transmission was occurring"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"Earlier the same day, WHO held a press briefing at which we said that, based on our past experience with coronaviruses, human-to-human transmission was likely"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"On the 13th of January, the first case was reported outside #China, in #Thailand. That day, working with partners, WHO published the first instructions for how to make PCR-based diagnostic test kits, enabling the world to find cases"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"On the 11th of January, #China shared the genetic sequence of the virus for countries to use in developing testing kits. On the same day, China reported the first death from the new #coronavirus"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"10th & 11th of Jan, WHO published a comprehensive package of guidance on how to detect, test for and manage cases & protect #healthworkers from potential human-to-human transmission, based on our previous experience with coronaviruses"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"On the same day, WHO also issued its first public Disease Outbreak News, publishing technical information for the scientific and public health communities, as well as the world鈥檚 media"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"On the 4th of January, WHO reported the cluster of cases on Twitter. At that stage, no deaths were reported"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"On the 3rd of January, #China provided information to WHO through a face-to-face meeting in Beijing, and through WHO鈥檚 Event Information System established under the International Health Regulations"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"Yesterday was GOARN鈥檚 20th birthday, and I鈥檇 like to take this opportunity to say thank you and congratulations to every single GOARN member for their commitment to responding to the #COVID19 pandemic and many other emergencies"-@DrTedros
"On the 2nd of January, WHO informed the Global Outbreak Alert and Response Network 鈥?or GOARN 鈥?which includes more than 260 institutions in more than 70 countries"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"On the 31st of December [2019], WHO鈥檚 Epidemic Intelligence System picked up a report about a cluster of cases of pneumonia of unknown cause in Wuhan, "-@DrTedros #COVID19
"Today I鈥檇 like to take a few moments to look back at the period preceding that announcement, to be clear about what WHO knew, and what we did"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"As of tomorrow, it will be three months since I declared a public health emergency of international concern over the outbreak of novel #coronavirus"-@DrTedros #COVID19

A risk assessment is a systematic process for gathering, assessing and documenting information to assign a level of risk. It provides the basis for taking action to manage and reduce the negative consequences of acute public health risks. #COVID19 #corona

Since WHO systematized its approach to risk assessments in 2012, this is the first time that the risk associated with an event has been assessed as 鈥渧ery high鈥?at the global level. #COVID19 #coronavirus

It is a common myth that persons who have died of a communicable disease should be cremated, but this is not true. Cremation is a matter of cultural choice and available resources https://bit.ly/2JWte00 #COVID19 #coronavirus

"Governments should be transparent with their populations, inform them regularly on how measures are being implemented and on the intended duration of these measures"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"Many countries have put in place very restrictive measures of physical distancing. These include closing borders, declaration of a national state of emergency, lockdowns of cities or entire countries, and closing schools and businesses"-@DrTedros #COVID1

Countries who have the heavy responsibility of accommodating these vulnerable populations must be given the necessary tools and resources to protect them and provide them with the support they need-@DrTedros #COVID19

"Rule of law has a critical role to play in fighting #COVID19 pandemic. As countries work to contain and mitigate the virus, many social challenges are arising, which require legal, regulatory and ethical responses"-@DrTedros

"A key principle of the International Health Regulations is that they must be implemented with full respect for dignity, human rights and the fundamental freedom of persons. This is essential"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"The #COVID19 pandemic has placed new pressures and responsibilities on states, on communities and on individuals. The rule of law is what guarantees the functioning and stability of our countries, which together make up the international community"-@DrTe

"We have just marked 100 days since we were first notified of the viral disease which has come to be known as #COVID19, and which has now spread across the world. Not only are we facing health severe consequences, but also major socio-economic disruptions

I also express my sympathy to all those in who have lost someone they love to #COVID19 & my best wishes for all those who are now fighting for their lives-@DrTedros addressing 's International Legal Forum

"Thank you for the opportunity of joining you today, and I鈥檇 like to express my gratitude to the Russian Federation for convening this very important event, under very difficult circumstances"-@DrTedros addressing 's International Legal Forum on #COVID19
also deserves recognition for its support of is European neighbors by sending essential supplies-@DrTedros addressing @TurkicCouncil on #COVID19

12 Mar 2020: #COVID19 expert mission to #Iran concludes
12 Mar 2020: During a 5-day mission to #Azerbaijan, a team of WHO experts works with the national response committee on developing a national preparedness and response plan for #COVID19. #coronavirus

11 March 2020: WHO characterizes #COVID19 as a pandemic. 90% of cases are still in just four countries. 81 countries have not reported any cases, and 57 countries have reported 10 cases or less. #coronavirus

8 Mar 2020: WHO publishes Interim guidance on critical preparedness, readiness and response actions for 4 different #COVID19 transmission scenarios: -No cases -Sporadic cases -Clusters of cases -Community transmission #coronavirus
6 Mar 2020: WHO publishes draft R&D blueprint draft for #COVID19: https://bit.ly/2xgbwC4 #coronavirus
5 Mar 2020: WHO launches a social media campaign called Be Ready for #COVID19, urging people to be safe, smart and kind. #coronavirus

2 Mar 2020: Mission of WHO experts arrives in #Iran, aiming to identify #COVID19 transmission dynamics and at-risk populations, as well as provide guidance on strengthening and scaling up the response and readiness efforts. #coronavirus

24 Feb 2020: A team of experts from WHO and the @ECDC_EU travelled to #Italy to understand how #COVID19 developed there, learning from the Italian experience and supporting control and prevention efforts by the authorities. #coronavirus
21 Feb 2020: @DrTedros appoints six special envoys on COVID-19, to provide strategic advice and high-level political advocacy and engagement in different parts of the world.
11-12 Feb 2020: WHO convenes a Research & Innovation Forum on #COVID19, attended by 400+ experts & funders from around the world. #coronavirus
5 Feb 2020: Global community asks for US$675 million to help protect vulnerable countries from #COVID19 outbreak. #coronavirus

30 Jan 2020: @DrTedros declares #COVID19 a Public Health Emergency of International Concern 鈥?WHO鈥檚 highest level of alarm 鈥?following a second meeting of the Emergency Committee convened under the International Health Regulations. #coronavirus

22- 23 Jan 2020: The committee, consisting of independent, international experts, is unable to reach a consensus based on the evidence available at the time. They ask to be reconvened within 10 days after receiving more information. #COVID19 #coronavirus

22- 23 Jan 2020: @DrTedros convenes an Emergency Committee under the International Health Regulations to assess whether the #COVID19 outbreak constitutes a public health emergency of international concern. #coronavirus

22 Jan 2020: WHO mission to #China issues a statement saying there is evidence of human-to-human transmission in Wuhan but more investigation is needed to understand the full extent of transmission. #COVID19 #coronavirus

14 Jan 2020: Dr @mvankerkhove notes in a press briefing there may have been limited human-to-human transmission of the #coronavirus (in the 41 confirmed cases), mainly through family members & that there was a risk of a possible wider outbreak.
13 Jan 2020: Officials confirm case of #COVID19 in #Thailand, the first recorded case outside . #coronavirus
12 Jan 2020: #China shares the genetic sequence of #COVID19. #coronavirus

10 Jan 2020: WHO issues a comprehensive package of technical guidance with advice to all countries on how to detect, test & manage potential cases, based on what was known about the virus at the time. #COVID19 #coronavirus

5 Jan 2020: WHO publishes first Disease Outbreak News on the new virus. This is a flagship technical publication to the scientific and public health community as well as global media. #COVID19 #coronavirus
4 Jan 2020: WHO reports on social media a cluster of pneumonia cases 鈥?with no deaths 鈥?in Wuhan, Hubei province, . #COVID19 #coronavirus https://twitter.com/WHO/status/1213523866703814656s=20

Spread the word #OpenWHO has free #COVID19 training from WHO experts in 17 languages, with more courses added every week. Sign up today https://bit.ly/3bvlPAO
During #COVID19, masks should be used as part of a comprehensive package of interventions.
In the community during #COVID19, we recommend the use of medical masks by people who are sick and those who are caring for a sick person at home.
In health care facilities during #COVID19, WHO has provided guidance for the use of medical masks, respirators and other personal protective equipment for #healthworkers.
We encourage countries that are considering the use of masks for the general population to study their effectiveness so we can all learn from their experience. #COVID19
If masks are worn, they must be used safely and properly. WHO has advice on how to put on, take off and dispose of masks. #COVID19

WHO understands that some countries have recommended or are considering the use of both medical & non-medical masks in the general population to prevent #COVID19. On 6 April, WHO issued guidance & criteria for countries to use in making that decision

"Every day, nurses are putting themselves at risk to alleviate suffering & save lives. They鈥檙e reorganizing wards to open more beds for #COVID19 patients, while continuing to provide care for other patients with urgent health needs, incl women in labour"-

"I support this proposal, and we are working with #CostaRica to finalize the details. Poorer countries & fragile economies stand to face the biggest shock from the #COVID19 pandemic, & leaving anyone unprotected will only prolong the health crisis

"Less than 100 days since WHO was notified about the new #coronavirus, research has accelerated at incredible speed. The viral genome was mapped in early January and shared globally, which enabled tests to be developed and vaccine research to start"-@DrTe

"Mask or no mask, there are proven things all of us can do to protect ourselves and others 鈥?keep your distance, clean your hands, cough or sneeze into your elbow, and avoid touching your face"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"There is no black or white answer, and no silver bullet. Masks alone cannot stop the #COVID19 pandemic. Countries must continue to find, test, isolate and treat every case and trace every contact"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"If masks are worn, they must be used safely and properly. WHO has guidance on how to put on, take off and dispose of masks. What is clear is that there is limited research in this area"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"For example, countries could consider using masks in communities where other measures such as cleaning hands and physical distancing are harder to achieve because of lack of water or cramped living conditions"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"WHO has been evaluating the use of medical and non-medical masks for #COVID19 more widely. Today, WHO is issuing guidance and criteria to support countries in making that decision"-@DrTedros #coronavirus
"In the community, we recommend the use of medical masks by people who are sick & those who are caring for a sick person at home"-@DrTedros #COVID19
"In health care facilities, WHO continues to recommend the use of medical masks, respirators & other personal protective equipment for #healthworkers"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"First and foremost, medical masks must be prioritized for #healthworkers on the front lines of the response. We know medical masks can help to protect health workers, but they鈥檙e in short supply globally"-@DrTedros #COVID19
We understand that some countries have recommended or are considering the use of both medical and non-medical masks in the general population to prevent the spread of #COVID19-@DrTedros
"As the #COVID19 pandemic continues, we recognise that individuals and governments want to do everything they can to protect themselves & others. So do we"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"We have said consistently that we鈥檙e all in this together, and we can only succeed together. We need an all-of-society approach, with everyone playing their part. That includes people in the entertainment industry"-@DrTedros #COVID19

text: "There is never any excuse for violence. We abhor all violence of all forms, at all times"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #EndViolence

"Make a plan to protect yourself & your children any way you can. This could include having a neighbour, friend, relative, or shelter identified to go to should you need to leave the house immediately"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #EndViolence
"If you are experiencing or at risk of domestic violence, speak to supportive family & friends, seek support from a hotline, or seek out local services for survivors"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #EndViolence

Women may have less contact with family & friends who may provide support & protection from violence. We call on countries to include services for addressing domestic violence as an essential service that must continue during the #COVID19 response-@DrTe

"Women in abusive relationships are more likely to be exposed to violence, as are their children, as family members spend more time in close contact, and families cope with additional stress and potential economic or job losses"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #EndVio

"Sadly, there are reports from some countries of an increase in domestic violence since the #COVID19 outbreak began. As people are asked to #stayhome, the risk of intimate partner violence is likely to increase"-@DrTedros #EndViolence

"The Global Polio Eradication Initiative is working to ensure that once it is safe to do so, countries can be supported to rapidly restart polio vaccination campaigns. While all our energy may be focused on #COVID19 now, our commitment to #EndPolio is uns

"To reduce the risk of increasing transmission of #COVID19, the #polio oversight board has made the hard decision to suspend house-to-house vaccination campaigns, knowing that this may lead to an increase in polio cases"-@DrTedros
"Many of those #healthworkers are now supporting the #COVID19 response. They are tracing contacts, finding cases and providing public health information to communities"-@DrTedros #coronavirus
"The #COVID19 pandemic is also having an effect on the fight against other diseases, like polio"-@DrTedros
"This may be particularly important for refugees, internally displaced persons, migrants and the homeless"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

Suspending user fees should be supported with measures to compensate providers for the loss of revenues. Govs should also consider using cash transfers to the most vulnerable households to overcome barriers to access-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"Several countries are suspending user fees & providing free testing and care for #COVID19, regardless of a person鈥檚 insurance, citizenship, or residence status. We encourage these measures. This is in an unprecedented crisis, which demands an unprecedent

" we call on all countries to remove financial barriers to care. If people delay or forego care because they can鈥檛 afford it, they not only harm themselves, they make the #COVID19 pandemic harder to control and put society at risk"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"If countries rush to lift restrictions quickly, the #coronavirus could resurge & the economic impact could be more severe & prolonged. Financing the health response is an essential investment not just in saving lives, but in the longer-term socia

"The best way for countries to end restrictions & ease their economic effects is to attack the #coronavirus, with the aggressive & comprehensive package of measures that we've spoken about many times before: find, test, isolate & treat every case

"For some countries, debt relief is essential to enable them to take care of their people & avoid economic collapse. This is an area of cooperation between WHO, the IMF and the @WorldBank"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus
"In the short term, countries can ease the burden on their populations through social welfare programs to ensure people have food & other life essentials"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"More than 1 million confirmed cases of #COVID19 have now been reported to WHO, including more than 50,000 deaths. But we know that this is much more than a health crisis. We are all aware of the profound social and economic consequences of the pandemic"-

The full briefing on #COVID19 by @DrTedros
"But what doesn鈥檛 change is WHO鈥檚 commitment to protecting the health of all people, based on the best science, without fear or favour"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus
"This is still a very new virus, and we are learning all the time. As the pandemic evolves, so does the evidence, and so does our advice"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"In these circumstances, masks are only effective when combined with other protective measures. WHO continues to gather all available evidence & continues to evaluate the potential use of masks more broadly to control #COVID19 transmission at the communit
There鈥檚 an ongoing debate about the use of masks at the community level. WHO recommends the use of medical masks for people who are sick and those caring for them-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus
That鈥檚 why we are continuing to work with governments and manufacturers to step up the production and distribution of personal protective equipment-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"We鈥檙e also continuing to study the evidence about the use of masks. WHO鈥檚 priority is that frontline #healthworkers are able to access essential personal protective equipment, including medical masks and respirators"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"As of this morning, more than 200 patients had been randomly assigned to one of the study arms. Each new patient who joins the trial gets us one step closer to knowing which drugs work"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"There has been an extraordinary response to our call for countries to join the Solidarity trial, which is comparing four drugs and drug combinations. So far, 74 countries have either joined the trial or are in the process of joining"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #
We鈥檙e also working hard with researchers all over the to generate the evidence about which medicines are most effective for treating #COVID19-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"We recommend #handwashing & physical distancing, but we recognize this can be a practical challenge for those who lack access to clean , or who live in cramped conditions"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus
We constantly review & update our guidance as we learn more & we are working to adapt it for specific contexts-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"WHO develops guidance based on the totality of evidence collected from around the world. Every day, our staff talk to thousands of experts around the world to collect and distil that evidence and experience"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"3 months ago, we knew almost nothing about this #coronavirus. Collectively, we have learned an enormous amount. And every day, we learn more. WHO is committed to serving all people everywhere with the best evidence to protect their health"-@DrTedros #COV

"Many developing countries will struggle to implement social welfare programs of this nature. For those countries, debt relief is essential to enable them to take care of their people and avoid economic collapse"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus
I have called on governments to put in place social welfare measures to ensure vulnerable people have food & other life essentials during this crisis-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"Many countries are asking people to stay at home and shutting down population movement, which can help to limit transmission of the #coronavirus, but can have unintended consequences for the poorest and most vulnerable people"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"It is critical that we ensure these countries are well equipped to detect, test, isolate and treat #COVID19 cases, and identify contacts 鈥?I am encouraged to see that this is occurring in many countries, despite limited resources"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"While relatively lower numbers of confirmed #COVID19 cases have been reported from Africa, and from Central and South America, we realize that COVID-19 could have serious social, economic and political consequences for these regions"-@DrTedros #coronavir
"The number of deaths has more than doubled in the past week. In the next few days we will reach 1 million confirmed #COVID19 cases, and 50 thousand deaths"-@DrTedros #coronavirus
"Over the past 5 weeks, we have witnessed a near exponential growth in the number of new #COVID19 cases, reaching almost every country, territory and area"-@DrTedros #coronavirus
"As we enter the 4th month since the start of the #COVID19 pandemic, I am deeply concerned about the rapid escalation and global spread of infection"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

Maintaining a healthy lifestyle is vital especially during #COVID19 outbreak. This includes: Eating healthy diets Staying physically active Quitting smoking Avoiding alcohol consumption Getting enough sleep http://bit.ly/33JFVo0 #coronavirus

Smoking damages your lungs and other parts of your body, and it makes you more vulnerable to #COVID19 infection. It is the right time to quit smoking for a safer and better health http://bit.ly/33JFVo0 #coronavirus

Using tobacco products can increase your chance of getting #COVID19 Bringing your to your can transfer the virus into your body Sharing tobacco products can transmit the virus btw. people Tobacco weakens your respiratory system making you more vulnerable

Looking after yourself, your family & friends is important through these stressful times. WHO encourages everyone at home to do simple & fun physical activities to stay healthy & active #COVID19 #coronavirus #BeActive

Being active every day is good for your body, mind and spirit especially during #COVID19 outbreak. And more activities you do can improve your sleep which is also important for good health #coronavirus #BeActive #HealthyAtHome

We can still beat #COVID19 with a comprehensive approach: test, trace, treat, isolate. In this video, @mvankerkhove talks about numerical forecasts of the #coronavirus's trajectory & reminds us that we can all prevent the worst, following WHO guidance

While you stay/work at home, reduce long periods spent sitting using active breaks every 30 mins Walk up & down the stairs Do some stretching exercise Dance to music for a few minutes Check out online resources to show you new ideas #COVID19 #coronavi

Be kind to yourself to #BeActive during #COVID19: Regularly check your sitting posture while working from home Break up your sitting & stand up while working , on the phone , or watching TV #coronavirus #HealthyAtHome

If you are at home because of #coronavirus, it's still important to stay active every day as much as you can. WHO recommends that all healthy adults do 30 minutes/day of physical activity, and children should be physically active for 1 hour/day. #COVID19

Doing any activity around the home is better than none at all. Be active during #COVID19 outbreak to maintain your heart health, muscle strength and flexibility. It is good for your mental health too! #coronavirus

When a woman with #COVID19 is too unwell to breastfeed, she should be supported to safely provide her baby with breastmilk if she wishes, in a way possible, available, and acceptable to her. This could include: expressing milk relactation donor human milk

All and women with babies, including those affected by #COVID19, should be supported to breastfeed their babies safely: Within 1 hour of birth Exclusively till 6 months of age Up to at least two years of age, with complementary foods https://bit.ly/2Wxz2F

Women with #COVID19 can breastfeed if they wish to do so. They should: Practice respiratory hygiene and wear a mask Wash before and after touching the baby Routinely clean and disinfect surfaces https://bit.ly/2Wxz2F1

Close contact and early, exclusive breastfeeding helps a baby to thrive. A woman with #COVID19 should be supported to: breastfeed safely hold her newborn skin-to-skin share a room with her baby https://bit.ly/2Wxz2F1

supporting a giving birth with suspected or confirmed #COVID19, must protect themselves & others through: washing wearing gloves, & protective clothing limiting the number of accompanying people maintaining a record of people entering the woman鈥檚

All have the right to a safe childbirth, whether or not they have a confirmed #COVID19. This includes: being treated with respect & dignity a companion of choice clear communication by maternity staff pain relief strategies mobility in labour where po

If you are pregnant, you can help protect yourself against #COVID19 by: Washing your hands frequently Keeping space between yourself and others Avoiding touching your eyes, nose and mouth Practicing respiratory hygiene https://bit.ly/2Wxz2F1

"#COVID19 is a shared threat. We can only face it together, and we can only overcome it together"-@DrTedros #coronavirus
"I wish to thank the @EU_Commission for its contribution of 232 million euros, which demonstrates the kind of global solidarity that gives me hope"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus
"But there are at least 3 priorities: 3. We must protect countries that are the most vulnerable, by doing our utmost to contain epidemics in countries with the capacity to do it"-@DrTedros #COVID19
There is no one-size-fits-all approach. Every country must make its own risk assessment for its own context-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"What we see are epidemics in different parts of the world, affecting countries in different ways & requiring a tailored response. The sudden increase in new #COVID19 cases is certainly very concerning. I have spoken consistently about the need for facts,

"For the moment, we are not witnessing the uncontained global spread of this #coronavirus, and we are not witnessing large-scale severe disease or death. Does this virus have pandemic potential? Absolutely. Are we there yet? From our assessment not yet"-

"Our decision about whether to use the word 鈥減andemic鈥?to describe an epidemic is based on an ongoing assessment of the geographical spread of the virus, the severity of disease it causes and the impact it has on the whole of society"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #

"Outside #China, there are now 2074 #COVID19 cases in 28 countries & 23 deaths. The sudden increases of cases in Italy, the Islamic Republic of Iran & the Republic of Korea are deeply concerning"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"Dr Bruce Aylward will give more detail tomorrow on behalf of the joint team. But the key message that should give all countries hope, courage and confidence is that this #coronavirus can be contained"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"The team also estimate that the measures taken in #China have averted a significant number of #COVID19 cases. The report contains a wealth of other information, highlights questions for which we still don鈥檛 have answers, & includes 22 recommendations

"They found that the fatality rate is between 2%-4% in Wuhan, & 0.7% outside Wuhan. They found that for people with mild #COVID19 disease, recovery time is about two weeks, while people with severe or critical disease recover within three to six weeks

They found that the #COVID19 epidemic peaked & plateaued between the 23rd of January & the 2nd of February & has been declining steadily since then. They have found that there has been no significant change in the DNA of the #coronavirus-@Dr
"The team has made a range of findings about the transmissibility of the #coronavirus, the severity of #COVID19 and the impact of the measures taken"-@DrTedros

"We have also held two calls with @UN resident coordinators all over the world, to brief them on the actions they can take to prepare their countries and ensure the United Nations system is working as one"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"We鈥檙e working with manufacturers of personal protective equipment [PPE] to address the severe disruption in the market for masks, gloves, gowns and other PPE, to ensure we can protect #healthworkers"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"We鈥檝e also shipped more than 30,000 sets of personal protective equipment to six countries in Africa, and we鈥檙e ready to ship almost 60,000 more sets to 19 countries in the coming weeks"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

"Some countries in Africa, including , are also leveraging the capacity they have built up to test for #Ebola to test for #COVID19. This is a great example of how investing in health systems can pay dividends for health security"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

"Our biggest concern continues to be the potential for #COVID19 to spread in countries with weaker health systems. In partnership with the @AfricaCDC, we鈥檙e working hard to prepare countries in Africa for the potential arrival of the virus"-@DrTedros #cor

"In 2% of reported cases, the #coronavirus is fatal, and the risk of death increases the older a patient is, and with underlying health conditions. We see relatively few cases among children. More research is needed to understand why"-@DrTedros #COVID19

"20% of patients have severe or critical #COVID19, ranging from shortness of breath to septic shock & multi-organ failure. These patients require intensive care using equipment such as respiratory support machines that are in short supply in many Afri

"Although the total number of #COVID19 cases outside #China remains relatively small, we are concerned about the number of cases with no clear epidemiological link, such as travel history to or contact with a confirmed case"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

Q: Can regularly rinsing your nose with saline solution help prevent infection with #2019nCoV? A: No. There is no evidence that regularly rinsing the nose with saline solution has protected people from infection with the new coronavirus. #KnowYourFacts
Q: Can gargling mouthwash protect you from infection with the #2019nCoV? A: No. There is no evidence that using mouthwash will protect you from infection with the new coronavirus. #KnowYourFacts

Q: Can eating garlic help prevent infection with #2019nCoV? A: Garlic is a healthy food that may have some antimicrobial properties. However, there is no evidence from the current outbreak that eating garlic has protected people from 2019-nCoV #KnowTheFac
Q: Does putting on or eating sesame oil block the #2019nC0V from entering the body? A: No. Sesame oil is delicious but it does not kill 2019-nCoV. #KnowTheFacts

The main driver of #2019-nCoV transmission, based on currently available data, is symptomatic cases. WHO is aware of possible transmission from infected people before they developed symptoms. WHO Situation Report 1 February 2020 http://bit.ly/36QhfKq

Asymptomatic #2019nCoV infection may be rare, and transmission from an asymptomatic person is very rare with other coronaviruses, as we have seen with MERS. Thus, transmission from asymptomatic cases is likely not a major driver of transmission http://bit

Q: Is it safe to receive a letter or a package from China? A: Yes, it is safe. People receiving packages from China are not at risk of contracting #2019nCoV. From previous analysis, we know coronaviruses do not survive long on objects, such as letters or

Q: Do vaccines against pneumonia protect you against #2019nCoV? A: No. Vaccines against pneumonia do not provide protection against 2019-nCoV. The virus is new and different. It needs its own vaccine. #KnowTheFacts
